explanations.A: The line going across the middle of the graph is called the x axis, but what do we call both the yellow lines together?
explanations.B: These lines are called the axes - going across is the x axis, and up/down is the y axis.
explanations.C: The origin is the center of the graph, where both lines are 0. What do we call the lines?
explanations.D: The line going down the middle of the graph is called the y axis, but what do we call both the yellow lines together?

explanations.A: The line going down the middle of the graph is called the y axis, but what do we call both the yellow lines together?
explanations.B: The line going across the middle of the graph is called the x axis, but what do we call both the yellow lines together?
explanations.C: The origin is the center of the graph, where both lines are 0. What do we call the lines?
explanations.D: These lines are called the axes - going across is the x axis, and down is the y axis.

explanations.A: The line going across the middle of the graph is called the x axis, but what do we call the point in the middle of both axes?
explanations.B: The two lines are the axes, but what do we call the point where they cross, where both lines are 0?
explanations.C: Where the two axes cross (at 0), we call that point the origin.
explanations.D: The line going down the middle of the graph is called the y axis, but what do we call the point in the middle of both axes?

explanations.A: The line going down the middle of the graph is called the y axis, but what do we call the point in the middle of both axes?
explanations.B: Where the two axes cross (at 0), we call that point the origin.
explanations.C: The two lines are the axes, but what do we call the point where they cross, at 0?
explanations.D: The line going across the middle of the graph is called the x axis, but what do we call the point in the middle of both axes?

explanations.A: Almost, but the x axis goes across the graph (think "x is a cross")
explanations.B: Only one of the axes is highlighted yellow, is it the x axis or the y axis?
explanations.C: The origin is the center of the graph, labeled 0. What do we call the lines?
explanations.D: The line going up and down the middle of the graph is called the y axis (think "y to the sky")

explanations.A: Exactly, the x axis goes across the graph (think "x is a cross").
explanations.B: Only one of the axes is highlighted yellow, is it the x axis or the y axis?
explanations.C: The origin is the center of the graph, labeled 0. What do we call the lines? Which one is highlighted?
explanations.D: The line going up and down the middle of the graph is called the y axis (think "y to the sky"). What do we call the line going across?

explanations.A: The x axis is the horizontal line across the middle of the graph, so is 2 the x-coordinate or the y-coordinate?
explanations.B: The x-coordinate tells us how far along the point is from 0 - this point is 2 along.
explanations.C: The y axis is the vertical line down the middle of the graph, so is 2 the x-coordinate or the y-coordinate?
explanations.D: I think you have mixed up x and y - the y coordinate tells us how far up the point is from 0, but this point is not 2 up, it's 2 to the right.

explanations.A: The x axis is the horizontal line across the middle of the graph, so is 5 the x-coordinate or the y-coordinate?
explanations.B: I think you have mixed up x and y - the x coordinate tells us how far along the point is from 0, but this point is not 5 to the right, it's 5 up...
explanations.C: The y axis is the vertical line down the middle of the graph, so is 5 the x-coordinate or the y-coordinate?
explanations.D: The y-coordinate tells us how far up the point is from 0 - this point is 5 up.

explanations.A: 2 is the x-coordinate, telling us to move 2 right in the x-direction from 0 to get to the point P.
explanations.B: I think you have mixed up x and y - the 5 tells us how far to move up in the y-direction from 0 to get to P.
explanations.C: Could this be more accurate? If we went 2 across from the edge of the graph, we wouldn't get to P...
explanations.D: If we go up 2 from the bottom of the graph, or from the axis, would we get to P? Think about which direction the 2 is telling us to move, and where from.

explanations.A: If we go across 5 from the bottom of the graph, or from the axis, would we get to P? Think about which direction the 5 is telling us to move, and where from...
explanations.B: 5 is the y-coordinate, telling us to go up 5 in the y-direction from 0 to get to the point P.
explanations.C: I think you have mixed up x-axis and y-axis...
explanations.D: Could this be more accurate? If we went 5 up from the edge of the graph, we wouldn't get to P...
